<i><small>**REMINDER: don't forget how to properly cite different <u>types</u> of texts. For the purpose of this class we will use MLA but Chicago is widely used in historical writing and APA is used in scientific literature.</i></small></h4>
</center>
<br>
<br>
<center>
<h3>CITATION examples:</h3>
</center>

<center>
<h4> 
An 1861 article titled, "Othello's Shadow," argued that the Shakespearean work presented a case for abolition of enslaved Africans.</h4>
</center>
<center>
<h4>As a widely acclaimed novel highlighting class disparities in 1920s New York, <i>The Great Gatsby</i> transformed the American literary  cannon.</h4>
</center>
<center>
<h4>William Carlos Williams' poem, "The Red Wheelbarrow," invites the reader to reconsider the foundations of daily life.</h4>
</center>
<center>
<h4>Broadcasted on American television during the 1990s, <u>The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air</u> managed to effectively refute a static representation of blackness in media.</h4>
</center>
